gw.api.databuilder.populator

Class PackagedValueFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.databuilder.populator.PackagedValueFactory

  • public class PackagedValueFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for BeanPopulator implementations. Allows builder users to specify data values in a variety of convenient forms.

    At "build" time, values specified by callers can be "packaged" via call to create(gw.lang.reflect.IType , Object). At "populate" time, the values can be "unpackaged" into a format suitable for setting on beans. The following types are supported:

    • Bean - can be specified as a Bean, a Key, or a DataBuilder.
    • arrays - can be specified as a Collection, an array, or null. When packaging an array, the elements are packaged recursively via create(gw.lang.reflect.IType , Object).
    • "scalar" values - can be specified eihter as a raw instance, or as a ValueGenerator.

    Generally, BeanPopulator implementations should not need to use this class directly. Implementations that extend AbstractBeanPopulator will have the packaging of populator values taken care of automatically.

    Author:
    pdalbora, tmcleskey

      static PackagedValue create(IType expectedType, java.lang.Object value)

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static PackagedValue create(IType expectedType,
                   java.lang.Object value)
        Packages the given value.
        Parameters:
        expectedType - if non-null, represents the type which the given value must yield at PackagedValue.getUnpackaged(gw.api.databuilder.BuilderContext) time. If null, then the caller is asserting no expected type. Note that expectedType must be specified for "collection" values.
        value - the object to package
        Returns:
        an object that can be used to generate a value suitable for populating a bean at BeanPopulator.execute(gw.pl.persistence.core.Bean) time.

      • create

        public static PackagedValue create(java.lang.Object value)
        Packages the given non-"collection" value.
        Parameters:
        value - the object to package
        Returns:
        an object that can be used to generate a value suitable for populating a bean at BeanPopulator.execute(gw.pl.persistence.core.Bean) time.
